comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110103 Firefox/4.0b9pre

The doorhanger notification for the restart after an add-on install has a dropdown which shows expanded only 'Not now' but collapsed 'Restart now' and clicking on the text of the latter one restarts the browser, doesn't open dropdown.

Expected result: Two buttons (or a dropdown and a button which performs the action, but not a click on the text of the dropdown shouldn't fire the action).

comments.raw_text:
Actual result:
1. Install an add-on which needs a restart to work, get the dropdown.
2. The dropdown contains an element which looks like a dropdown with "Restart now" as currently selected element and a down arrow as extender next to it.
3. Clicking the "Restart now" as a dropdown element should show the full dropdown list. At the moment it performs the action

This seems to be a dupe of bug 581193 which is labeled as fixed, but on Windows XP this doesn't look like a button at all.

Expected result: Two buttons (or a dropdown and a button which performs the action, but not a click on the text of the dropdown shouldn't fire the action).
